TEXT: The applicants , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE , PERSON , PERSON , ORG and PERSON . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in Poitiers .

On DATE the applicants applied to an employment tribunal in a dispute between themselves and their employer , contesting the grade in which they had been placed under an additional clause modifying a workplace agreement .
On DATE the employment tribunal gave judgment in their favour .
On DATE their employer appealed . On DATE ORG varied the first - instance judgment .

On DATE ORG of ORG dismissed an appeal on a point of law lodged by the applicants , ruling that their ground of appeal was “ not such as to warrant admitting the appeal ” , thus applying Article L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of LAW , as amended by PERSON no . DATE of DATE , which had introduced a special procedure for the consideration of appeals on points of law .
The relevant part of LAW , as amended by PERSON no . DATE of DATE , provides :
“ After pleadings have been filed cases before a civil division shall be tried by a bench of CARDINAL judges of the division to which they have been assigned .
The bench shall refuse to admit appeals which are inadmissible or not founded on a serious ground of cassation . ”
